GuardrailList.Description: Disallow deletion of Amazon S3 buckets created by AWS Control Tower in the log archive account.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Disallow deletion of log archive
GuardrailList.Name: AWS-GR_AUDIT_BUCKET_DELETION_PROHIBITED

GuardrailList.Description: Protect the integrity of your log archive through encryption at rest using server side encryption (SSE) with KMS customer-created master keys (CMK).
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Enable encryption at rest for log archive
GuardrailList.Name: AWS-GR_AUDIT_BUCKET_ENCRYPTION_ENABLED

GuardrailList.Description: Track log archive access requests using S3 bucket access logging.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Enable access logging for log archive
GuardrailList.Name: AWS-GR_AUDIT_BUCKET_LOGGING_ENABLED

GuardrailList.Description: Protect the integrity of your log archive by ensuring no policy changes happen to the S3 bucket by any user.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Disallow policy changes to log archive
GuardrailList.Name: AWS-GR_AUDIT_BUCKET_POLICY_CHANGES_PROHIBITED

GuardrailList.Description: Control access to your log archive's Amazon S3 bucket by disallowing public read access.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Disallow public read access to log archive
GuardrailList.Name: AWS-GR_AUDIT_BUCKET_PUBLIC_READ_PROHIBITED

GuardrailList.Description: Control access to your log archive's Amazon S3 bucket by disallowing public write access.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Disallow public write access to log archive
GuardrailList.Name: AWS-GR_AUDIT_BUCKET_PUBLIC_WRITE_PROHIBITED

GuardrailList.Description: Limit data retention in the log archive using a retention policy that defaults to 365 days.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Set a retention policy for log archive
GuardrailList.Name: AWS-GR_AUDIT_BUCKET_RETENTION_POLICY

GuardrailList.Description: Detects whether Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling groups have public IP addresses enabled through launch configurations. This rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the launch configuration for an Auto Scaling group has the value of the field AssociatePublicIpAddress set as True.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Detect whether public IP addresses for Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling are enabled through launch configurations
GuardrailList.Name: AWS-GR_AUTOSCALING_LAUNCH_CONFIG_PUBLIC_IP_DISABLED

GuardrailList.Description: Log API activity in a consistent manner by ensuring that your AWS CloudTrail settings do not change.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Disallow configuration changes to AWS CloudTrail
GuardrailList.Name: AWS-GR_CLOUDTRAIL_CHANGE_PROHIBITED

GuardrailList.Description: Perform real-time analysis of activity data by sending CloudTrail events to AWS CloudWatch logs.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Integrate CloudTrail events with CloudWatch logs
GuardrailList.Name: AWS-GR_CLOUDTRAIL_CLOUDWATCH_LOGS_ENABLED

GuardrailList.Description: Track AWS API call activity within your accounts using AWS CloudTrail, which records call history including the identity of the caller and the time of the call.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Enable AWS CloudTrail in all available regions
GuardrailList.Name: AWS-GR_CLOUDTRAIL_ENABLED

GuardrailList.Description: Protect the integrity of account activity logs using AWS CloudTrail log file validation, which creates a digitally signed digest file containing a hash of each log that CloudTrail writes to Amazon S3.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Enable integrity validation for CloudTrail log file
GuardrailList.Name: AWS-GR_CLOUDTRAIL_VALIDATION_ENABLED

GuardrailList.Description: Protect the integrity of Amazon CloudWatch configuration set up by Control Tower to monitor your environment.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Disallow changes to CloudWatch set up by Control Tower
GuardrailList.Name: AWS-GR_CLOUDWATCH_EVENTS_CHANGE_PROHIBITED

GuardrailList.Description: Disallow deletion of AWS Config Aggregation Authorizations created by AWS Control Tower in the audit account.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Disallow deletion of AWS Config Aggregation Authorizations
GuardrailList.Name: AWS-GR_CONFIG_AGGREGATION_AUTHORIZATION_POLICY

GuardrailList.Description: Protect the integrity of AWS Config aggregation set up by Control Tower to collect configuration and compliance data.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Disallow changes to AWS Config aggregation set up by Control Tower
GuardrailList.Name: AWS-GR_CONFIG_AGGREGATION_CHANGE_PROHIBITED

GuardrailList.Description: Record resource configurations in a consistent manner by ensuring that AWS Config settings don't change.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Disallow configuration changes to AWS Config
GuardrailList.Name: AWS-GR_CONFIG_CHANGE_PROHIBITED

GuardrailList.Description: Identify configuration changes on AWS resources using AWS Config.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Enable AWS Config in all available regions
GuardrailList.Name: AWS-GR_CONFIG_ENABLED

GuardrailList.Description: Protect the integrity of AWS Config Rules set up by Control Tower to implement detective guardrails.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Disallow changes to AWS Config Rules set up by Control Tower
GuardrailList.Name: AWS-GR_CONFIG_RULE_CHANGE_PROHIBITED

GuardrailList.Description: Protect the integrity of your log archive by ensuring that no encryption configuration changes occur to the S3 buckets created by AWS Control Tower.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Disallow Changes to Encryption Configuration for AWS Control Tower Created S3 Buckets in Log Archive
GuardrailList.Name: AWS-GR_CT_AUDIT_BUCKET_ENCRYPTION_CHANGES_PROHIBITED

GuardrailList.Description: Protect the integrity of your log archive by ensuring that no lifecycle configuration changes occur to the S3 buckets created by AWS Control Tower.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Disallow Changes to Lifecycle Configuration for AWS Control Tower Created S3 Buckets in Log Archive
GuardrailList.Name: AWS-GR_CT_AUDIT_BUCKET_LIFECYCLE_CONFIGURATION_CHANGES_PROHIBITED

GuardrailList.Description: Protect the integrity of your log archive by ensuring that no logging configuration changes occur to the S3 buckets created by AWS Control Tower.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Disallow Changes to Logging Configuration for AWS Control Tower Created S3 Buckets in Log Archive
GuardrailList.Name: AWS-GR_CT_AUDIT_BUCKET_LOGGING_CONFIGURATION_CHANGES_PROHIBITED

GuardrailList.Description: Protect the integrity of your log archive by ensuring that no bucket policy changes occur to the S3 buckets created by AWS Control Tower.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Disallow Changes to Bucket Policy for AWS Control Tower Created S3 Buckets in Log Archive
GuardrailList.Name: AWS-GR_CT_AUDIT_BUCKET_POLICY_CHANGES_PROHIBITED

GuardrailList.Description: Detects whether an account has AWS CloudTrail or CloudTrail Lake enabled. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if either CloudTrail or CloudTrail Lake is not enabled in an account.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Detect whether an account has AWS CloudTrail or CloudTrail Lake enabled.
GuardrailList.Name: AWS-GR_DETECT_CLOUDTRAIL_ENABLED_ON_MEMBER_ACCOUNTS

GuardrailList.Description: Detects whether a shared account in the Security organizational unit has AWS CloudTrail or CloudTrail Lake enabled. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if either CloudTrail or CloudTrail Lake is not enabled in an account.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Detect whether a shared account in the Security organizational unit has AWS CloudTrail or CloudTrail Lake enabled.
GuardrailList.Name: AWS-GR_DETECT_CLOUDTRAIL_ENABLED_ON_SHARED_ACCOUNTS

GuardrailList.Description: Disallow cross-region networking connections from Amazon EC2, Amazon CloudFront, and AWS Global Accelerator services.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Disallow cross-region networking for Amazon EC2, Amazon CloudFront, and AWS Global Accelerator
GuardrailList.Name: AWS-GR_DISALLOW_CROSS_REGION_NETWORKING

GuardrailList.Description: Disallow internet access for an Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) instance managed by a customer, rather than by an AWS service.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Disallow internet access for an Amazon VPC instance managed by a customer
GuardrailList.Name: AWS-GR_DISALLOW_VPC_INTERNET_ACCESS

GuardrailList.Description: Disallows Virtual Private Network (VPN) connections (Site-to-Site VPN and Client VPN) to an Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (VPC).
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Disallow Amazon Virtual Private Network (VPN) connections
GuardrailList.Name: AWS-GR_DISALLOW_VPN_CONNECTIONS

GuardrailList.Description: Detects whether AWS Database Migration Service replication instances are public. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the value of the PubliclyAccessible field is set as True.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Detect whether replication instances for AWS Database Migration Service are public
GuardrailList.Name: AWS-GR_DMS_REPLICATION_NOT_PUBLIC

GuardrailList.Description: Launch Amazon EC2 instances only with an Amazon EBS volume that is performance optimized. EBS-optimized volumes minimize contention between Amazon EBS I/O and other traffic from your instance.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Disallow launch of EC2 instance types that are not EBS optimized
GuardrailList.Name: AWS-GR_EBS_OPTIMIZED_INSTANCE

GuardrailList.Description: Detects whether all AWS accounts have access to restore Amazon EBS snapshots. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if any snapshots have the RestorableByUserIds field set to the value All. In that case, the Amazon EBS snapshots are public.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Detect whether Amazon EBS snapshots are restorable by all AWS accounts
GuardrailList.Name: AWS-GR_EBS_SNAPSHOT_PUBLIC_RESTORABLE_CHECK

GuardrailList.Description: Detects whether an Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) instance has an associated public IPv4 address. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the public IP field is present in the Amazon EC2 instance configuration item. This guardrail applies only to IPv4 addresses.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Detect whether any Amazon EC2 instance has an associated public IPv4 address
GuardrailList.Name: AWS-GR_EC2_INSTANCE_NO_PUBLIC_IP

GuardrailList.Description: Do not allow an Amazon EBS volume, a durable, block-level storage device that you can attach to a single EC2 instance, to persist independently from the running life of an EC2 instance.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Disallow EBS volumes that are unattached to an EC2 instance
GuardrailList.Name: AWS-GR_EC2_VOLUME_INUSE_CHECK

GuardrailList.Description: Detects whether an Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service (Amazon EKS) endpoint is publicly accessible. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the endpoint is publicly accessible.Â
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Detect whether an Amazon EKS endpoint is blocked from public access
GuardrailList.Name: AWS-GR_EKS_ENDPOINT_NO_PUBLIC_ACCESS

GuardrailList.Description: Detects whether Amazon OpenSearch Service domains are in Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (Amazon VPC). The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the OpenSearch Service domain endpoint is public.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Detect whether an Amazon OpenSearch Service domain is in Amazon VPC
GuardrailList.Name: AWS-GR_ELASTICSEARCH_IN_VPC_ONLY

GuardrailList.Description: Detects whether any Amazon Elastic MapReduce (EMR) cluster master nodes have public IP addresses. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if a master node has a public IP. This guardrail checks clusters that are in RUNNING or WAITING state.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Detect whether any Amazon EMR cluster master nodes have public IP addresses
GuardrailList.Name: AWS-GR_EMR_MASTER_NO_PUBLIC_IP

GuardrailList.Description: Secure EBS volumes attached to EC2 instances through encryption.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Enable encryption for EBS volumes attached to EC2 instances
GuardrailList.Name: AWS-GR_ENCRYPTED_VOLUMES

GuardrailList.Description: Protect the integrity of IAM roles set up for your accounts by Control Tower.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Disallow changes to IAM roles set up by AWS Control Tower and AWS CloudFormation
GuardrailList.Name: AWS-GR_IAM_ROLE_CHANGE_PROHIBITED

GuardrailList.Description: Protect your account by requiring multi-factor authentication (MFA) for any AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) user using the account. MFA adds an extra authentication code on top of a user name and password.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Disallow access to IAM users without MFA
GuardrailList.Name: AWS-GR_IAM_USER_MFA_ENABLED

GuardrailList.Description: Protect the integrity of AWS Lambda functions set up by Control Tower.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Disallow changes to Lambda functions set up by Control Tower
GuardrailList.Name: AWS-GR_LAMBDA_CHANGE_PROHIBITED

GuardrailList.Description: Detects whether the AWS Lambda function policy attached to the Lambda resource prohibits public access. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the Lambda function policy allows public access.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Detect whether the AWS Lambda function policy attached to the Lambda resource blocks public access
GuardrailList.Name: AWS-GR_LAMBDA_FUNCTION_PUBLIC_ACCESS_PROHIBITED

GuardrailList.Description: Disallow changes to CloudWatch Logs Log Groups created by AWS Control Tower in the log archive account.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Disallow changes to CloudWatch Logs Log Groups
GuardrailList.Name: AWS-GR_LOG_GROUP_POLICY

GuardrailList.Description: Protect your account by requiring multi-factor authentication (MFA) for any AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) user using the console. MFA adds an extra authentication code on top of a user name and password.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Disallow console access to IAM users without MFA
GuardrailList.Name: AWS-GR_MFA_ENABLED_FOR_IAM_CONSOLE_ACCESS

GuardrailList.Description: Detects whether public routes exist in the route table associated with an Internet Gateway (IGW). The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if a route has a destination CIDR block of '0.0.0.0/0' or '::/0' or if a destination CIDR block does not match the rule parameter.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Detect whether public routes exist in the route table for an Internet Gateway (IGW)
GuardrailList.Name: AWS-GR_NO_UNRESTRICTED_ROUTE_TO_IGW

GuardrailList.Description: Secure your Amazon RDS database instances by disallowing public access.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Disallow public access to RDS database instances
GuardrailList.Name: AWS-GR_RDS_INSTANCE_PUBLIC_ACCESS_CHECK

GuardrailList.Description: Secure your Amazon RDS database snapshots by disallowing public access.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Disallow public access to RDS database snapshots
GuardrailList.Name: AWS-GR_RDS_SNAPSHOTS_PUBLIC_PROHIBITED

GuardrailList.Description: Secure your Amazon RDS database instances at rest by encrypting the underlying storage for database instances and their automated backups, Read Replicas, and snapshots.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Disallow RDS database instances without storage encryption
GuardrailList.Name: AWS-GR_RDS_STORAGE_ENCRYPTED

GuardrailList.Description: Detects whether Amazon Redshift clusters are blocked from public access. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the publiclyAccessible field is true in the cluster configuration item.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Detect whether Amazon Redshift clusters are blocked from public access
GuardrailList.Name: AWS-GR_REDSHIFT_CLUSTER_PUBLIC_ACCESS_CHECK

GuardrailList.Description: Disallows the specified actions except in Regions with status Governed by AWS Control Tower.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Disallow the specified actions except in Regions with status Governed by AWS Control Tower
GuardrailList.Name: AWS-GR_REGION_DENY

GuardrailList.Description: Reduces a server's exposure to risk by removing unfettered connectivity to remote console services such as RDP.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Disallow Internet connection via RDP
GuardrailList.Name: AWS-GR_RESTRICTED_COMMON_PORTS

GuardrailList.Description: Reduces a server's exposure to risk by removing unfettered connectivity to remote console services such as SSH.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Disallow Internet connection via SSH
GuardrailList.Name: AWS-GR_RESTRICTED_SSH

GuardrailList.Description: Secure your AWS accounts by disallowing account access with root user credentials, which are credentials of the account owner and allow unrestricted access to all resources in the account. We recommend that you instead create AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) users for everyday interaction with your AWS account.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Disallow actions as a root user
GuardrailList.Name: AWS-GR_RESTRICT_ROOT_USER

GuardrailList.Description: Secure your AWS accounts by disallowing creation of access keys for the root user, which will allow unrestricted access to all resources in the account. We recommend that you instead create access keys for an AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) user for everyday interaction with your AWS account.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Disallow creation of access keys for the root user
GuardrailList.Name: AWS-GR_RESTRICT_ROOT_USER_ACCESS_KEYS

GuardrailList.Description: Contain the location of your S3 data to a single region by disabling any automatic, asynchronous copying of objects across buckets to other AWS Regions.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Disallow cross region replication for S3 buckets
GuardrailList.Name: AWS-GR_RESTRICT_S3_CROSS_REGION_REPLICATION

GuardrailList.Description: Protect your S3 buckets by requiring multi-factor authentication (MFA) for delete actions. MFA adds an extra authentication code on top of a user name and password.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Disallow delete actions on S3 buckets without MFA
GuardrailList.Name: AWS-GR_RESTRICT_S3_DELETE_WITHOUT_MFA

GuardrailList.Description: Reduce vulnerability from weak authentication by using Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA), which adds an extra authentication code on top of a user name and password.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Enable MFA for the root user
GuardrailList.Name: AWS-GR_ROOT_ACCOUNT_MFA_ENABLED

GuardrailList.Description: Periodically detects whether the required Amazon S3 settings to block public access are configured as true for the account, rather than for a bucket or an access point.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Detect whether Amazon S3 settings to block public access are set as true for the account
GuardrailList.Name: AWS-GR_S3_ACCOUNT_LEVEL_PUBLIC_ACCESS_BLOCKS_PERIODIC

GuardrailList.Description: Secure access to data stored in Amazon S3 buckets by disallowing public reads.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Disallow public read access to S3 buckets
GuardrailList.Name: AWS-GR_S3_BUCKET_PUBLIC_READ_PROHIBITED

GuardrailList.Description: Secure access to data stored in Amazon S3 buckets by disallowing public writes.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Disallow public write access to S3 buckets
GuardrailList.Name: AWS-GR_S3_BUCKET_PUBLIC_WRITE_PROHIBITED

GuardrailList.Description: Protect your S3 buckets by keeping multiple versions of all objects. Versioning allows you to recover objects from accidental deletion or overwrite.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Disallow S3 buckets that are not versioning enabled
GuardrailList.Name: AWS-GR_S3_VERSIONING_ENABLED

GuardrailList.Description: Detects whether direct internet access is allowed for an Amazon SageMaker notebook instance. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if Amazon SageMaker notebook instances allow direct internet access.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Detect whether an Amazon SageMaker notebook instance allows direct internet access
GuardrailList.Name: AWS-GR_SAGEMAKER_NOTEBOOK_NO_DIRECT_INTERNET_ACCESS

GuardrailList.Description: Protect the integrity of Amazon SNS notification settings set up by Control Tower.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Disallow changes to Amazon SNS set up by Control Tower
GuardrailList.Name: AWS-GR_SNS_CHANGE_PROHIBITED

GuardrailList.Description: Protect the integrity of Amazon SNS subscriptions set up by Control Tower to trigger notifications for Config Rule compliance changes.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Disallow changes to Amazon SNS subscriptions set up by Control Tower
GuardrailList.Name: AWS-GR_SNS_SUBSCRIPTION_CHANGE_PROHIBITED

GuardrailList.Description: Detects whether AWS Systems Manager (SSM) documents owned by the account are public. This rule is NON_COMPLIANT if any documents with owner 'Self' are public.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Detect whether AWS Systems Manager documents owned by the account are public
GuardrailList.Name: AWS-GR_SSM_DOCUMENT_NOT_PUBLIC

GuardrailList.Description: Detects whether Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (Amazon VPC) subnets are assigned a public IP address. The rule is COMPLIANT if Amazon VPC does not have subnets that are assigned a public IP address. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if Amazon VPC has subnets that are assigned a public IP address.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Detect whether any Amazon VPC subnets are assigned a public IP address
GuardrailList.Name: AWS-GR_SUBNET_AUTO_ASSIGN_PUBLIC_IP_DISABLED

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether any AWS Certificate Manager (ACM) Private CA certificates have wildcard domain names instead of single domain names.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an AWS Private CA certificate to have a single domain name
GuardrailList.Name: CT.ACM.PR.1

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether all methods in Amazon API Gateway stage have execution logging configured.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an Amazon API Gateway REST and WebSocket API to have logging activated
GuardrailList.Name: CT.APIGATEWAY.PR.1

GuardrailList.Description: This control ensures that AWS X-Ray tracing is enabled on Amazon API Gateway REST APIs.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an Amazon API Gateway REST API stage to have AWS X-Ray tracing activated
GuardrailList.Name: CT.APIGATEWAY.PR.2

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon API Gateway REST API stage that has caching enabled also encrypts the caches.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require that an Amazon API Gateway REST API stage has encryption at rest configured for cache data
GuardrailList.Name: CT.APIGATEWAY.PR.3

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether Amazon API Gateway V2 stages have access logging enabled. Access logging is supported for HTTP and WebSocket APIs.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an Amazon API Gateway V2 stage to have access logging activated
GuardrailList.Name: CT.APIGATEWAY.PR.4

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether Amazon API Gateway V2 API routes have an authorization type set.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require Amazon API Gateway V2 Websocket and HTTP routes to specify an authorization type
GuardrailList.Name: CT.APIGATEWAY.PR.5

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether an AWS AppSync GraphQL API has been configured to send request-level and field-level logs to Amazon CloudWatch Logs.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an AWS AppSync GraphQL API to have logging enabled
GuardrailList.Name: CT.APPSYNC.PR.1

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether your Auto Scaling group spans multiple Availability Zones.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling group to have multiple Availability Zones
GuardrailList.Name: CT.AUTOSCALING.PR.1

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling launch configuration is configured to require the use of Instance Metadata Service Version 2 (IMDSv2).
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling group launch configuration to configure Amazon EC2 instances for IMDSv2
GuardrailList.Name: CT.AUTOSCALING.PR.2

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling launch configuration has a metadata token hop limit set to '1'.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling launch configuration to have a single-hop metadata response limit
GuardrailList.Name: CT.AUTOSCALING.PR.3

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether your Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling groups that are associated with a load balancer are using Elastic Load Balancing health checks.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling group associated with an AWS Elastic Load Balancer (ELB) to have ELB health checks activated
GuardrailList.Name: CT.AUTOSCALING.PR.4

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling groups have public IP addresses configured through launch configurations.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require that an Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling group launch configuration does not have Amazon EC2 instances with public IP addresses
GuardrailList.Name: CT.AUTOSCALING.PR.5

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling group uses multiple instance types, by means of a mixed instance policy and explicit instance type overrides.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require any Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling groups to use multiple instance types
GuardrailList.Name: CT.AUTOSCALING.PR.6

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling group is configured to use an EC2 launch template.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling group to have EC2 launch templates configured
GuardrailList.Name: CT.AUTOSCALING.PR.8

GuardrailList.Description: This control disallows management of the following extension types in the AWS CloudFormation registry: resource types, modules, and hooks.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Disallow management of resource types, modules, and hooks within the AWS CloudFormation registry
GuardrailList.Name: CT.CLOUDFORMATION.PR.1

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon CloudFront distribution is configured to return a specific object that is the default root object.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an Amazon CloudFront distribution to have a default root object configured
GuardrailList.Name: CT.CLOUDFRONT.PR.1

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether your Amazon CloudFront distributions backed by Amazon S3 are configured to use an origin access control.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require any Amazon CloudFront distributions with Amazon S3 backed origins to have origin access control configured
GuardrailList.Name: CT.CLOUDFRONT.PR.10

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether your Amazon CloudFront distributions are using deprecated SSL protocols for HTTPS communication between CloudFront edge locations and custom origins.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an Amazon CloudFront distribution to use updated SSL protocols between edge locations and custom origins
GuardrailList.Name: CT.CLOUDFRONT.PR.11

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether Amazon CloudFront distributions backed by Amazon S3 are configured with an origin access identity.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require any Amazon CloudFront distributions with Amazon S3 backed origins to have an origin access identity configured
GuardrailList.Name: CT.CLOUDFRONT.PR.2

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether your Amazon CloudFront distributions use HTTPS, either directly or through a redirection.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an Amazon CloudFront distribution to have encryption in transit configured
GuardrailList.Name: CT.CLOUDFRONT.PR.3

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether your Amazon CloudFront distribution is configured with an origin group that contains two origin group members.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an Amazon CloudFront distribution to have origin failover configured
GuardrailList.Name: CT.CLOUDFRONT.PR.4

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether Amazon CloudFront distributions are configured with access logging.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require any Amazon CloudFront distribution to have logging enabled
GuardrailList.Name: CT.CLOUDFRONT.PR.5

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether the certificate associated with an Amazon CloudFront distribution is a custom SSL/TLS certificate.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an Amazon CloudFront distribution to use custom SSL/TLS certificates
GuardrailList.Name: CT.CLOUDFRONT.PR.6

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether your Amazon CloudFront distributions are configured to use SNI to serve HTTPS requests.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an Amazon CloudFront distribution to use SNI to serve HTTPS requests
GuardrailList.Name: CT.CLOUDFRONT.PR.7

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether your Amazon CloudFront distributions are encrypting traffic to custom origins.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an Amazon CloudFront distribution to encrypt traffic to custom origins
GuardrailList.Name: CT.CLOUDFRONT.PR.8

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether your Amazon CloudFront distributions are using a minimum security policy and cipher suite of TLSv1.2 or greater for viewer connections.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an Amazon CloudFront distribution to have a security policy of TLSv1.2 as a minimum
GuardrailList.Name: CT.CLOUDFRONT.PR.9

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether your AWS CloudTrail is configured to use the server-side encryption (SSE) AWS KMS key encryption.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an AWS CloudTrail trail to have encryption at rest activated
GuardrailList.Name: CT.CLOUDTRAIL.PR.1

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether log file integrity validation is enabled on an AWS CloudTrail trail.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an AWS CloudTrail trail to have log file validation activated
GuardrailList.Name: CT.CLOUDTRAIL.PR.2

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether your AWS CloudTrail trail is configured to send logs to Amazon CloudWatch Logs.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an AWS CloudTrail trail to have an Amazon CloudWatch log group configuration
GuardrailList.Name: CT.CLOUDTRAIL.PR.3

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon CloudWatch alarm has at least one action configured for the alarm state.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an Amazon CloudWatch alarm to have an action configured for the alarm state
GuardrailList.Name: CT.CLOUDWATCH.PR.1

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon CloudWatch Log Group retention period is set to a value greater than or equal to 365 days.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an Amazon CloudWatch log group to be retained for at least one year
GuardrailList.Name: CT.CLOUDWATCH.PR.2

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon CloudWatch log group is encrypted at rest with an AWS KMS key
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an Amazon CloudWatch log group to be encrypted at rest with an AWS KMS key
GuardrailList.Name: CT.CLOUDWATCH.PR.3

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon CloudWatch alarm has actions enabled.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an Amazon CloudWatch alarm to have actions activated
GuardrailList.Name: CT.CLOUDWATCH.PR.4

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether the GitHub or Bitbucket source repository URL contains either personal access tokens or a username and password.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require OAuth on GitHub or Bitbucket source repository URLs for AWS CodeBuild projects
GuardrailList.Name: CT.CODEBUILD.PR.1

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether AWS CodeBuild projects contain environment variables 'AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID' and 'AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY' stored as 'PLAINTEXT'.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require any AWS CodeBuild project environment variable to encrypt credentials in environment variables
GuardrailList.Name: CT.CODEBUILD.PR.2

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether AWS CodeBuild projects environment has at least one logging option enabled.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require any AWS CodeBuild project environment to have logging configured
GuardrailList.Name: CT.CODEBUILD.PR.3

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether AWS CodeBuild projects have privileged mode turned off.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require any AWS CodeBuild project to deactivate privileged mode when running
GuardrailList.Name: CT.CODEBUILD.PR.4

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether AWS CodeBuild projects are configured to encrypt artifacts.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require encryption on all AWS CodeBuild project artifacts
GuardrailList.Name: CT.CODEBUILD.PR.5

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether AWS CodeBuild projects configured with Amazon S3 logs have encryption enabled.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require encryption on all Amazon S3 logs for AWS CodeBuild projects
GuardrailList.Name: CT.CODEBUILD.PR.6

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether your AWS DMS replication instance is public.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require that a public AWS DMS replication instance is not public
GuardrailList.Name: CT.DMS.PR.1

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether storage encryption is enabled for an Amazon DocumentDB (with MongoDB compatibility) cluster.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an Amazon DocumentDB cluster to be encrypted at rest
GuardrailList.Name: CT.DOCUMENTDB.PR.1

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon DocumentDB cluster retention period is set to seven or more days (>=7).
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an Amazon DocumentDB cluster to have automatic backups enabled
GuardrailList.Name: CT.DOCUMENTDB.PR.2

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether point-in-time recovery (PITR) is enabled for an Amazon DynamoDB table.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require that point-in-time recovery for an Amazon DynamoDB table is activated
GuardrailList.Name: CT.DYNAMODB.PR.1

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether your Amazon DynamoDB table is encrypted with an AWS Key Management Service (KMS) key.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an Amazon DynamoDB table to be encrypted at rest using an AWS KMS key
GuardrailList.Name: CT.DYNAMODB.PR.2

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether your Amazon EC2 launch templates are configured with Instance Metadata Service Version 2 (IMDSv2).
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an Amazon EC2 launch template to have IMDSv2 configured
GuardrailList.Name: CT.EC2.PR.1

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether the Amazon EC2 launch template has detailed monitoring enabled.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require Amazon EC2 launch templates to have Amazon CloudWatch detailed monitoring activated
GuardrailList.Name: CT.EC2.PR.10

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether your Amazon VPC subnets automatically assign public IP addresses.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require that an Amazon EC2 subnet does not automatically assign public IP addresses
GuardrailList.Name: CT.EC2.PR.11

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether an AWS::EC2::Instance resource specifies multiple ENIs (Elastic Network Interfaces) in the NetworkInterfaces property.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an Amazon EC2 instance to specify at most one network interface by means of the NetworkInterfaces property in the AWS::EC2::Instance resource
GuardrailList.Name: CT.EC2.PR.12

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon EC2 instance has detailed monitoring enabled.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an Amazon EC2 instance to have detailed monitoring enabled
GuardrailList.Name: CT.EC2.PR.13

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon EC2 launch template has a metadata token hop limit set to '1'.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require that Amazon EC2 launch templates restrict the token hop limit to a maximum of one
GuardrailList.Name: CT.EC2.PR.2

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether the Amazon EC2 security group rule contains the string '0.0.0.0/0' or '::/0' as a source IP range. This control is not triggered if a rule allows connection to port 80 or 443 with TCP, UDP, ICMP, or ICMPv6.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require that any Amazon EC2 security group rule does not use the source IP range 0.0.0.0/0 or ::/0 for ports other than 80 and 443
GuardrailList.Name: CT.EC2.PR.3

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon EC2 security group rule that contains the strings '0.0.0.0/0' or '::/0' as a source IP range does not allow incoming TCP, UDP, ICMP, ICMPv6 traffic to the following ports: '3389', '20', '23', '110', '143', '3306', '8080', '1433', '9200', '9300', '25', '445', '135', '21', '1434', '4333', '5432', '5500', '5601', '22', '3000', '5000', '8088', '8888'.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require that any Amazon EC2 security group rule does not use the source IP range 0.0.0.0/0 or ::/0 for specific high-risk ports
GuardrailList.Name: CT.EC2.PR.4

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether the Amazon EC2 network ACL inbound entry allows unrestricted incoming traffic ('0.0.0.0/0' or '::/0') for SSH or RDP.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require any Amazon EC2 network ACL to prevent ingress from 0.0.0.0/0 to port 22 or port 3389
GuardrailList.Name: CT.EC2.PR.5

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether Amazon EC2 transit gateways are configured to accept Amazon VPC attachment requests automatically.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require that Amazon EC2 transit gateways refuse automatic Amazon VPC attachment requests
GuardrailList.Name: CT.EC2.PR.6

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether your standalone Amazon EC2 EBS volume and Amazon EBS volume created through an EC2 instance Block Device Mapping are encrypted at rest. Specifically, it checks that the Encrypted property is set to true in either the EBS volume resource definition or an EC2 instance resource definition's BlockDeviceMappings property.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an Amazon EBS volume resource to be encrypted at rest when defined by means of the AWS::EC2::Instance BlockDeviceMappings property or AWS::EC2::Volume resource type
GuardrailList.Name: CT.EC2.PR.7

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether your Amazon EC2 instance is configured NOT to associate a public IP address by default, and it requires configuring the AssociatePublicIpAddress parameter to false on a new network interface created by means of the NetworkInterfaces property.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an Amazon EC2 instance to set AssociatePublicIpAddress to false on a new network interface created by means of the NetworkInterfaces property in the AWS::EC2::Instance resource
GuardrailList.Name: CT.EC2.PR.8

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether your Amazon EC2 launch templates are configured to assign public IP addresses to network interfaces.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require any Amazon EC2 launch template not to auto-assign public IP addresses to network interfaces
GuardrailList.Name: CT.EC2.PR.9

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether a private Amazon Elastic Container Registry (ECR) repository has at least one lifecycle policy configured.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require Amazon ECR repositories to have a lifecycle policy configured
GuardrailList.Name: CT.ECR.PR.1

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether a private Amazon ECR repository has image scanning enabled.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require Amazon ECR private repositories to have image scanning enabled
GuardrailList.Name: CT.ECR.PR.2

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether a private Amazon ECR repository has tag immutability enabled.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require Amazon ECR private repositories to have tag immutability enabled
GuardrailList.Name: CT.ECR.PR.3

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether Amazon ECS Fargate services are configured to deploy using the 'LATEST' platform version rather than a specified version number.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require AWS ECS Fargate Services to run on the latest Fargate platform version
GuardrailList.Name: CT.ECS.PR.1

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether Amazon Elastic Container Service (ECS) task definitions are configured to share a host's process namespace with its containers.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require that Amazon ECS task definitions do not share the host's process namespace
GuardrailList.Name: CT.ECS.PR.10

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether container definitions in Amazon Elastic Container Service (ECS) task definitions are configured with elevated privileges.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an Amazon ECS container to run as non-privileged
GuardrailList.Name: CT.ECS.PR.11

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether Amazon Elastic Container Service (ECS) task definition container definitions include environment variables named 'AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID', 'AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY', or 'ECS_ENGINE_AUTH_DATA'.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require that Amazon ECS task definitions do not pass secrets as container environment variables
GuardrailList.Name: CT.ECS.PR.12

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether your Amazon ECS clusters have container insights enabled.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require any Amazon ECS cluster to have container insights activated
GuardrailList.Name: CT.ECS.PR.2

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether Amazon Elastic Container Service (ECS) task definitions run as a non-root user within Amazon ECS containers.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require any Amazon ECS task definition to specify a user that is not the root
GuardrailList.Name: CT.ECS.PR.3

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether the networking mode for Amazon Elastic Container Service (ECS) task definitions is set to 'awsvpc'.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require Amazon ECS tasks to use 'awsvpc' networking mode
GuardrailList.Name: CT.ECS.PR.4

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether Amazon Elastic Container Service (ECS) task definitions have a logging configuration specified.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an active Amazon ECS task definition to have a logging configuration
GuardrailList.Name: CT.ECS.PR.5

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether Amazon ECS task definitions have been configured to require read-only access to container root filesystems.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require Amazon ECS containers to allow read-only access to the root filesystem
GuardrailList.Name: CT.ECS.PR.6

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether Amazon Elastic Container Service (ECS) task definitions have specified a memory limit for container definitions.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an Amazon ECS task definition to have a specific memory usage limit
GuardrailList.Name: CT.ECS.PR.7

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether Amazon Elastic Container Service (ECS) task definitions that use 'host' networking mode have a privileged container definition, and whether they specify a non-root user definition.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require Amazon ECS task definitions to have secure networking modes and user definitions
GuardrailList.Name: CT.ECS.PR.8

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether your Amazon ECS services are configured to assign public IP addresses automatically.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require Amazon ECS services not to assign public IP addresses automatically
GuardrailList.Name: CT.ECS.PR.9

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service (EKS) cluster endpoint disallows public access to the cluster Kubernetes API server endpoint.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an Amazon EKS cluster to be configured with public access disabled to the cluster Kubernetes API server endpoint.
GuardrailList.Name: CT.EKS.PR.1

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon ElastiCache Redis cluster has automatic backups enabled.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an Amazon ElastiCache for Redis cluster to have automatic backups activated
GuardrailList.Name: CT.ELASTICACHE.PR.1

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon ElastiCache for Redis cluster has automatic minor version upgrades enabled.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an Amazon ElastiCache for Redis cluster to have automatic minor version upgrades activated
GuardrailList.Name: CT.ELASTICACHE.PR.2

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon ElastiCache Redis replication group has automatic failover enabled.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an Amazon ElastiCache for Redis replication group to have automatic failover activated
GuardrailList.Name: CT.ELASTICACHE.PR.3

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon ElastiCache replication group has the encryption-at-rest setting enabled.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an Amazon ElastiCache replication group to have encryption at rest activated
GuardrailList.Name: CT.ELASTICACHE.PR.4

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon ElastiCache replication group has encryption-in-transit enabled.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an Amazon ElastiCache for Redis replication group to have encryption in transit activated
GuardrailList.Name: CT.ELASTICACHE.PR.5

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon ElastiCache cache cluster is configured with a custom subnet group.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an Amazon ElastiCache cache cluster to use a custom subnet group
GuardrailList.Name: CT.ELASTICACHE.PR.6

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon ElastiCache replication group with an engine version earlier than 6.0 has Redis AUTH enabled.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an Amazon ElastiCache replication group of earlier Redis versions to have Redis AUTH activated
GuardrailList.Name: CT.ELASTICACHE.PR.7

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether AWS Elastic Beanstalk environments and configuration templates are configured for 'enhanced' health reporting.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require AWS Elastic Beanstalk environments to have enhanced health reporting enabled
GuardrailList.Name: CT.ELASTICBEANSTALK.PR.1

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether managed platform updates in AWS Elastic Beanstalk environments and configuration templates are activated.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an AWS Elastic Beanstalk environment to have managed platform updates configured
GuardrailList.Name: CT.ELASTICBEANSTALK.PR.2

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether an AWS Elastic Beanstalk environment is configured to send logs to Amazon CloudWatch Logs.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an AWS Elastic Beanstalk environment to have a logging configuration
GuardrailList.Name: CT.ELASTICBEANSTALK.PR.3

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon EFS file system is configured to encrypt file data using AWS KMS.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an Amazon EFS file system to encrypt file data at rest using AWS KMS
GuardrailList.Name: CT.ELASTICFILESYSYSTEM.PR.1

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether your Amazon EFS file system has been configured with automatic backups through AWS Backup.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an Amazon EFS volume to have an automated backup plan
GuardrailList.Name: CT.ELASTICFILESYSYSTEM.PR.2

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether your Amazon EFS access points are configured to enforce a root directory.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require Amazon EFS access points to have a root directory
GuardrailList.Name: CT.ELASTICFILESYSYSTEM.PR.3

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether your Amazon EFS access points are configured to enforce a user identity.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require Amazon EFS access points to enforce a user identity
GuardrailList.Name: CT.ELASTICFILESYSYSTEM.PR.4

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether HTTP to HTTPS redirection is configured as a default action on HTTP listeners of application load balancers.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require any application load balancer listener default actions to redirect all HTTP requests to HTTPS
GuardrailList.Name: CT.ELASTICLOADBALANCING.PR.1

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether classic load balancers have logging enabled.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an ELB application or classic load balancer to have logging activated
GuardrailList.Name: CT.ELASTICLOADBALANCING.PR.10

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether ELB classic load balancers have connection draining configured.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require any ELB classic load balancer to have connection draining activated
GuardrailList.Name: CT.ELASTICLOADBALANCING.PR.11

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether ELB classic load balancer HTTPS/SSL listeners use the predefined security policy 'ELBSecurityPolicy-TLS-1-2-2017-01'.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require any ELB classic load balancer SSL/HTTPS listener to have a predefined security policy with a strong configuration
GuardrailList.Name: CT.ELASTICLOADBALANCING.PR.12

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether cross-zone load balancing is configured for your classic load balancer.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require any ELB classic load balancer to have cross-zone load balancing activated
GuardrailList.Name: CT.ELASTICLOADBALANCING.PR.13

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether your Amazon Elastic Load Balancing (ELB) application and network load balancers use certificates provided by AWS Certificate Manager (ACM).
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require any Amazon ELB application or network load balancer to have an AWS Certificate Manager certificate
GuardrailList.Name: CT.ELASTICLOADBALANCING.PR.2

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks to ensure that an application load balancer is configured with 'defensive' or 'strictest' desync mitigation mode.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require any application load balancer to have defensive or strictest desync mitigation mode activated
GuardrailList.Name: CT.ELASTICLOADBALANCING.PR.3

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether application load balancers are configured to drop non-valid HTTP headers.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require that any application load balancer must be configured to drop HTTP headers
GuardrailList.Name: CT.ELASTICLOADBALANCING.PR.4

GuardrailList.Description: Checks whether an Elastic Load Balancer (ELB) has deletion protection activated.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require that application load balancer deletion protection is activated
GuardrailList.Name: CT.ELASTICLOADBALANCING.PR.5

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether your ELB application and network load balancers have logging activated.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require that application and network load balancer access logging is activated
GuardrailList.Name: CT.ELASTICLOADBALANCING.PR.6

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether an ELB classic load balancer has been configured with multiple Availability Zones.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require any classic load balancer to have multiple Availability Zones configured
GuardrailList.Name: CT.ELASTICLOADBALANCING.PR.7

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether classic load balancers use HTTPS/SSL certificates provided by AWS Certificate Manager.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require any classic load balancer SSL/HTTPS listener to have a certificate provided by AWS Certificate Manager
GuardrailList.Name: CT.ELASTICLOADBALANCING.PR.8

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether your AWS Elastic Load Balancing (ELB) classic load balancer front-end listeners are configured with HTTPS or SSL protocols.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require that an AWS ELB application or classic load balancer listener is configured with HTTPS or TLS termination
GuardrailList.Name: CT.ELASTICLOADBALANCING.PR.9

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether Amazon S3 protection is enabled on an Amazon GuardDuty detector.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an Amazon GuardDuty detector to have Amazon S3 protection activated
GuardrailList.Name: CT.GUARDDUTY.PR.1

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks that AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) inline policies do not include "Effect": "Allow" with "Action": "*" over "Resource": "*".
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require that an AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) inline policy does not have a statement that includes "*" in the Action and Resource elements
GuardrailList.Name: CT.IAM.PR.1

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) customer managed policies do not include "Effect": "Allow" with "Action": "*" over "Resource": "*".
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require that AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) customer-managed policies do not contain a statement that includes "*" in the Action and Resource elements
GuardrailList.Name: CT.IAM.PR.2

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks that AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) customer-managed policies do not contain statements of "Effect": "Allow" with "Action": "Service:*" (for example, s3:*) for individual AWS services, and that the policies do not use the combination of "NotAction" with an "Effect" of "Allow".
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require that AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) customer-managed policies do not have wildcard service actions
GuardrailList.Name: CT.IAM.PR.3

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether your AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) user has inline or managed (AWS and customer) policies directly attached. Instead, IAM users should inherit permissions from IAM groups or roles.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require that an AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) user does not have an inline or managed policy attached attached
GuardrailList.Name: CT.IAM.PR.4

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) inline policies do not include "Effect": "Allow" with "Action": "Service:*" (e.g. s3:*) for individual AWS services or use the combination of "NotAction" with an "Effect" of "Allow".
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require that AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) inline policies do not have wildcard service actions
GuardrailList.Name: CT.IAM.PR.5

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether Amazon Kinesis data streams are encrypted at rest with server-side encryption.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require any Amazon Kinesis data stream to have encryption at rest configured
GuardrailList.Name: CT.KINESIS.PR.1

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether key rotation is enabled for AWS KMS customer-managed keys.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require any AWS KMS key to have rotation configured
GuardrailList.Name: CT.KMS.PR.1

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether an AWS Lambda function resource-based policy prohibits public access.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require AWS Lambda function policies to prohibit public access
GuardrailList.Name: CT.LAMBDA.PR.2

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether an AWS Lambda function has been configured with access to resources in a customer-managed Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (VPC).
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an AWS Lambda function to be in a customer-managed Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (VPC)
GuardrailList.Name: CT.LAMBDA.PR.3

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon Neptune cluster has AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) database authentication enabled.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an Amazon Neptune DB cluster to have AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) database authentication enabled
GuardrailList.Name: CT.NEPTUNE.PR.1

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon Neptune cluster has deletion protection enabled.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an Amazon Neptune DB cluster to have deletion protection enabled
GuardrailList.Name: CT.NEPTUNE.PR.2

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon Neptune cluster has storage encryption enabled.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an Amazon Neptune DB cluster to have storage encryption enabled
GuardrailList.Name: CT.NEPTUNE.PR.3

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether there is at least one stateful or stateless rule group associated with an AWS Network Firewall firewall policy.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require any AWS Network Firewall firewall policy to have an associated rule group
GuardrailList.Name: CT.NETWORK-FIREWALL.PR.1

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether an AWS Network Firewall firewall policy is configured with a user-defined stateless default action for full packets.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require any AWS Network Firewall firewall policy to drop or forward stateless full packets by default when they do not match a rule
GuardrailList.Name: CT.NETWORK-FIREWALL.PR.2

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether an AWS Network Firewall firewall policy is configured with a default action to drop or forward fragmented packets, when the packets do not match a stateless rule.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require any AWS Network Firewall firewall policy to drop or forward fragmented packets by default when they do not match a stateless rule
GuardrailList.Name: CT.NETWORK-FIREWALL.PR.3

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether an AWS Network Firewall stateless rule group contains rules.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require any AWS Network Firewall rule group to contain at least one rule
GuardrailList.Name: CT.NETWORK-FIREWALL.PR.4

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether Elasticsearch domains have encryption-at-rest enabled.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an Elasticsearch domain to encrypt data at rest
GuardrailList.Name: CT.OPENSEARCH.PR.1

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether Amazon OpenSearch Service domains are configured with VPC option settings that specify a target Amazon VPC.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an Amazon OpenSearch Service domain to be created in a user-specified Amazon VPC
GuardrailList.Name: CT.OPENSEARCH.PR.10

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether Amazon OpenSearch Service domains have node-to-node encryption enabled.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an Amazon OpenSearch Service domain to encrypt data sent between nodes
GuardrailList.Name: CT.OPENSEARCH.PR.11

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether Amazon OpenSearch Service domains are configured to send error logs to an Amazon CloudWatch Logs log group.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an Amazon OpenSearch Service domain to send error logs to Amazon CloudWatch Logs
GuardrailList.Name: CT.OPENSEARCH.PR.12

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether Amazon OpenSearch Service domains are configured to send audit logs to an Amazon CloudWatch Logs log group.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an Amazon OpenSearch Service domain to send audit logs to Amazon CloudWatch Logs
GuardrailList.Name: CT.OPENSEARCH.PR.13

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether Amazon OpenSearch Service domains are configured with at least three data nodes and zone awareness enabled.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an Amazon OpenSearch Service domain to have zone awareness and at least three data nodes
GuardrailList.Name: CT.OPENSEARCH.PR.14

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether Amazon OpenSearch Service domains have fine-grained access control enabled.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an Amazon OpenSearch Service domain to use fine-grained access control
GuardrailList.Name: CT.OPENSEARCH.PR.15

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether Amazon OpenSearch Service domains are configured to require HTTPS with a minimum TLS version of TLSv1.2.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an Amazon OpenSearch Service domain to use TLSv1.2
GuardrailList.Name: CT.OPENSEARCH.PR.16

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether Elasticsearch domains are configured with VPC option settings that specify a target Amazon VPC.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an Elasticsearch domain to be created in a user-specified Amazon VPC
GuardrailList.Name: CT.OPENSEARCH.PR.2

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether Elasticsearch domains have node-to-node encryption enabled.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an Elasticsearch domain to encrypt data sent between nodes
GuardrailList.Name: CT.OPENSEARCH.PR.3

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether Elasticsearch domains are configured to send error logs to an Amazon CloudWatch Logs log group.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an Elasticsearch domain to send error logs to Amazon CloudWatch Logs
GuardrailList.Name: CT.OPENSEARCH.PR.4

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether Elasticsearch domains are configured to send audit logs to an Amazon CloudWatch Logs log group.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an Elasticsearch domain to send audit logs to Amazon CloudWatch Logs
GuardrailList.Name: CT.OPENSEARCH.PR.5

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether ElasticSearch domains are configured with at least three data nodes and zone awareness enabled.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an Elasticsearch domain to have zone awareness and at least three data nodes
GuardrailList.Name: CT.OPENSEARCH.PR.6

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether Elasticsearch domains are configured with at least three dedicated master nodes.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an Elasticsearch domain to have at least three dedicated master nodes
GuardrailList.Name: CT.OPENSEARCH.PR.7

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether Elasticsearch Service domains are configured to require HTTPS with a minimum TLS version of TLSv1.2.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an Elasticsearch Service domain to use TLSv1.2
GuardrailList.Name: CT.OPENSEARCH.PR.8

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether Amazon OpenSearch Service domains have encryption-at-rest enabled.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an Amazon OpenSearch Service domain to encrypt data at rest
GuardrailList.Name: CT.OPENSEARCH.PR.9

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether high availability is configured for your Amazon RDS database instances.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require that an Amazon RDS database instance is configured with multiple Availability Zones
GuardrailList.Name: CT.RDS.PR.1

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether Amazon RDS DB instances are configured to copy all tags to snapshots created.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an Amazon RDS database instance to copy tags to snapshots
GuardrailList.Name: CT.RDS.PR.10

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon RDS database (DB) instance is deployed in a VPC (that is, an EC2 VPC instance).
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an Amazon RDS database instance to have a VPC configuration
GuardrailList.Name: CT.RDS.PR.11

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether your Amazon RDS event subscriptions for RDS clusters are configured to notify on event categories of 'maintenance' and 'failure.'
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an Amazon RDS event subscription to have critical cluster events configured
GuardrailList.Name: CT.RDS.PR.12

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) instance has deletion protection activated.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require any Amazon RDS instance to have deletion protection configured
GuardrailList.Name: CT.RDS.PR.13

GuardrailList.Description: This rules checks whether Amazon Relational Database Service (RDS) instances have all available log types configured for export to Amazon CloudWatch Logs.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an Amazon RDS database instance to have logging configured
GuardrailList.Name: CT.RDS.PR.14

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether any Amazon Relational Database Services (RDS) database (DB) security groups are created by, or associated to, an RDS DB instance, because DB security groups are intended for the EC2-Classic platform only.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require that an Amazon RDS instance does not create DB security groups
GuardrailList.Name: CT.RDS.PR.15

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether the storage encryption is configured on Amazon Relational Database Service (RDS) database (DB) clusters that are not being restored from an existing cluster.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an Amazon RDS database cluster to have encryption at rest configured
GuardrailList.Name: CT.RDS.PR.16

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether your Amazon RDS event subscriptions for RDS instances are configured to notify on event categories of 'maintenance', 'failure', and 'configuration change'.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an Amazon RDS event notification subscription to have critical database instance events configured
GuardrailList.Name: CT.RDS.PR.17

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether your Amazon RDS event subscriptions for RDS parameter groups are configured to notify on event categories of 'configuration change.'
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an Amazon RDS event notification subscription to have critical database parameter group events configured
GuardrailList.Name: CT.RDS.PR.18

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether your Amazon RDS event subscriptions for RDS security groups are configured to notify on event categories of 'failure' and 'configuration change'
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an Amazon RDS event notifications subscription to have critical database security group events configured
GuardrailList.Name: CT.RDS.PR.19

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether enhanced monitoring is activated for Amazon RDS instances.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an Amazon RDS database instance or cluster to have enhanced monitoring configured
GuardrailList.Name: CT.RDS.PR.2

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether Amazon Relational Database Service (RDS) database instances are configured for default database port for their specific engine types.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an Amazon RDS database instance not to use a database engine default port
GuardrailList.Name: CT.RDS.PR.20

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon Relational Database Service (RDS) database (DB) cluster has changed the administrator username from its default value.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an Amazon RDS DB cluster to have a unique administrator username
GuardrailList.Name: CT.RDS.PR.21

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon RDS database has changed the adminstrator username from its default value.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an Amazon RDS database instance to have a unique administrator username
GuardrailList.Name: CT.RDS.PR.22

GuardrailList.Description: This rule checks whether Amazon Relational Database Service (RDS) database (DB) instances are publicly accessible, as determined by checking the 'PubliclyAccessible' configuration property.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an Amazon RDS database instance to not be publicly accessible
GuardrailList.Name: CT.RDS.PR.23

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether storage encryption is enabled for your Amazon RDS database (DB) instance.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an Amazon RDS database instance to have encryption at rest configured
GuardrailList.Name: CT.RDS.PR.24

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether Amazon RDS database clusters have all available log types enabled for export to Amazon CloudWatch Logs.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an Amazon RDS database cluster to have logging configured
GuardrailList.Name: CT.RDS.PR.25

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether your Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) cluster has deletion protection activated.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an Amazon RDS cluster to have deletion protection configured
GuardrailList.Name: CT.RDS.PR.3

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon Relational Database Service (RDS) database (DB) cluster has AWS IAM database authentication activated.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an Amazon RDS database cluster to have AWS IAM database authentication configured
GuardrailList.Name: CT.RDS.PR.4

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether automatic minor version upgrades are enabled for an Amazon RDS database instance.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an Amazon RDS database instance to have minor version upgrades configured
GuardrailList.Name: CT.RDS.PR.5

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon Relational Database Service (RDS) database (DB) cluster has backtracking enabled.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an Amazon RDS database cluster to have backtracking configured
GuardrailList.Name: CT.RDS.PR.6

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon RDS database (DB) instance has AWS IAM database authentication activated.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require Amazon RDS database instances to have AWS IAM authentication configured
GuardrailList.Name: CT.RDS.PR.7

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether Amazon RDS database (DB) instances have automated backups enabled, and verifies that the backup retention period is greater than or equal to seven (7) days.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an Amazon RDS database instance to have automatic backups configured
GuardrailList.Name: CT.RDS.PR.8

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon RDS DB cluster is configured to copy all tags to snapshots created.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an Amazon RDS database cluster to copy tags to snapshots
GuardrailList.Name: CT.RDS.PR.9

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether Amazon Redshift clusters are configured to not be publicly accessible.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an Amazon Redshift cluster to prohibit public access
GuardrailList.Name: CT.REDSHIFT.PR.1

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether Amazon Redshift clusters have automated snapshots enabled, and set with an automated snapshot retention period greater than or equal to seven (7) days.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an Amazon Redshift cluster to have automatic snapshots configured
GuardrailList.Name: CT.REDSHIFT.PR.2

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon Redshift cluster has audit logging activated.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an Amazon Redshift cluster to have audit logging configured
GuardrailList.Name: CT.REDSHIFT.PR.3

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether automatic major version upgrades are enabled for your Amazon Redshift cluster.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an Amazon Redshift cluster to have automatic upgrades to major versions configured
GuardrailList.Name: CT.REDSHIFT.PR.4

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon Redshift cluster has enhanced VPC routing configured.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an Amazon Redshift cluster to have enhanced VPC routing
GuardrailList.Name: CT.REDSHIFT.PR.5

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon Redshift cluster has changed the administrator username from its default value.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an Amazon Redshift cluster to have a unique administrator username
GuardrailList.Name: CT.REDSHIFT.PR.6

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon Redshift cluster has changed its database name from the default value.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an Amazon Redshift cluster to have a unique database name
GuardrailList.Name: CT.REDSHIFT.PR.7

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon Redshift cluster is encrypted.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an Amazon Redshift cluster to be encrypted
GuardrailList.Name: CT.REDSHIFT.PR.8

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether your Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) bucket has a bucket-level Block Public Access (BPA) configuration.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an Amazon S3 bucket to have block public access settings configured
GuardrailList.Name: CT.S3.PR.1

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether default server-side encryption is enabled on an Amazon S3 bucket using AWS KMS.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an Amazon S3 bucket to have server-side encryption configured using an AWS KMS key
GuardrailList.Name: CT.S3.PR.10

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) bucket has versioning enabled.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an Amazon S3 bucket to have versioning enabled
GuardrailList.Name: CT.S3.PR.11

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether server access logging is enabled for your Amazon S3 bucket.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an Amazon S3 bucket to have server access logging configured
GuardrailList.Name: CT.S3.PR.2

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether your Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) version-enabled bucket has a lifecycle policy configured.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an Amazon S3 buckets to have versioning configured and a lifecycle policy
GuardrailList.Name: CT.S3.PR.3

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether Amazon S3 events notifications are enabled on your Amazon S3 bucket.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an Amazon S3 bucket to have event notifications configured
GuardrailList.Name: CT.S3.PR.4

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether your Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) bucket allows user permissions through access control lists.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require that an Amazon S3 bucket does not manage user access with an access control list (ACL)
GuardrailList.Name: CT.S3.PR.5

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether a lifecycle rule is configured for Amazon S3 buckets.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an Amazon S3 bucket to have lifecycle policies configured
GuardrailList.Name: CT.S3.PR.6

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether default server-side encryption is enabled on your Amazon S3 bucket.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an Amazon S3 bucket to have server-side encryption configured
GuardrailList.Name: CT.S3.PR.7

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether Amazon S3 bucket policies require requests to use Secure Socket Layer (SSL).
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require that Amazon S3 bucket requests use Secure Sockets Layer
GuardrailList.Name: CT.S3.PR.8

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) bucket has been configured to use S3 Object Lock.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require that an Amazon S3 bucket has S3 Object Lock activated
GuardrailList.Name: CT.S3.PR.9

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks that direct internet access is not allowed for an Amazon SageMaker notebook instance.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an Amazon SageMaker notebook instance to prevent direct internet access
GuardrailList.Name: CT.SAGEMAKER.PR.1

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon SageMaker notebook instance is configured to launch within a custom Amazon VPC.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require Amazon SageMaker notebook instances to be deployed within a custom Amazon VPC
GuardrailList.Name: CT.SAGEMAKER.PR.2

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether Amazon SageMaker notebook instances allow root access.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require Amazon SageMaker notebook instances to have root access disallowed
GuardrailList.Name: CT.SAGEMAKER.PR.3

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon SQS queue is configured with a dead-letter queue.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require any Amazon SQS queue to have a dead-letter queue configured
GuardrailList.Name: CT.SQS.PR.1

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon SQS queue is encrypted at rest.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require any Amazon SQS queue to have encryption at rest configured
GuardrailList.Name: CT.SQS.PR.2

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether an AWS Step Functions state machine has logging enabled.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an AWS Step Functions state machine to have logging activated
GuardrailList.Name: CT.STEPFUNCTIONS.PR.1

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether an AWS Step Functions state machine has AWS X-Ray tracing enabled.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an AWS Step Functions state machine to have AWS X-Ray tracing activated
GuardrailList.Name: CT.STEPFUNCTIONS.PR.2

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether an AWS WAF Classic regional rule contains any conditions.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require any AWS WAF regional rule to have a condition
GuardrailList.Name: CT.WAF-REGIONAL.PR.1

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether an AWS WAF Classic regional web ACL contains any WAF rules or rule groups.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require any AWS WAF regional web access control list (ACL) to have a rule or rule group
GuardrailList.Name: CT.WAF-REGIONAL.PR.2

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether an AWS WAF Classic global rule contains any conditions.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require any AWS WAF global rule to have a condition
GuardrailList.Name: CT.WAF.PR.1

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether an AWS WAF Classic global web ACL contains any WAF rules or rule groups.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require any AWS WAF global web ACL to have a rule or rule group
GuardrailList.Name: CT.WAF.PR.2

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether an AWS WAFv2 web ACL contains any WAF rules or WAF rule groups.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an AWS WAFV2 web ACL to be non-empty
GuardrailList.Name: CT.WAFV2.PR.1

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether AWS WAFV2 rule groups contain rules.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Require an AWS WAFV2 rule group to be non-empty
GuardrailList.Name: CT.WAFV2.PR.2

GuardrailList.Description: This AWS control checks whether ACM Certificates in your account are marked for expiration within a specified time period. Certificates provided by ACM are automatically renewed. ACM does not automatically renew certificates that you import.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Imported and ACM-issued certificates should be renewed after a specified time period
GuardrailList.Name: SH.ACM.1

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether all stages of Amazon API Gateway REST and WebSocket APIs have logging enabled. The control fails if logging is not enabled for all methods of a stage or if loggingLevel is neither ERROR nor INFO.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: API Gateway REST and WebSocket API execution logging should be enabled
GuardrailList.Name: SH.APIGateway.1

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether Amazon API Gateway REST API stages have SSL certificates configured that backend systems can use to authenticate that incoming requests are from the API Gateway.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: API Gateway REST API stages should be configured to use SSL certificates for backend authentication
GuardrailList.Name: SH.APIGateway.2

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether AWS X-Ray active tracing is enabled for your Amazon API Gateway REST API stages.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: API Gateway REST API stages should have AWS X-Ray tracing enabled
GuardrailList.Name: SH.APIGateway.3

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks to see if an API Gateway stage is using an AWS WAF Web ACL. This control fails if an AWS WAF Web ACL is not attached to a REST API Gateway stage.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: API Gateway should be associated with a WAF Web ACL
GuardrailList.Name: SH.APIGateway.4
