GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether all methods in Amazon API Gateway REST API stages that have cache enabled are encrypted. The control fails if any method in API Gateway REST API stage is configured to cache and the cache is not encrypted.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: API Gateway REST API cache data should be encrypted at rest
GuardrailList.Name: SH.APIGateway.5

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks if Amazon API Gateway routes have an authorization type. The control fails if the API Gateway route does not specify an authorization type
GuardrailList.DisplayName: API Gateway routes should specify an authorization type
GuardrailList.Name: SH.APIGateway.8

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks if Amazon API Gateway V2 stages have access logging configured. This control fails if access log settings arenât defined.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Access logging should be configured for API Gateway V2 Stages
GuardrailList.Name: SH.APIGateway.9

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks if an Amazon Web Services (AWS) account has security contact information. The control fails if security contact information is not provided for the account.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Security contact information should be provided for an AWS account.
GuardrailList.Name: SH.Account.1

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether your Auto Scaling groups that are associated with a load balancer are using Elastic Load Balancing health checks.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Auto scaling groups associated with a load balancer should use load balancer health checks
GuardrailList.Name: SH.AutoScaling.1

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether an Auto Scaling group spans multiple Availability Zones. The control fails if an Auto Scaling group does not span multiple availability zones.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling group should cover multiple Availability Zones
GuardrailList.Name: SH.AutoScaling.2

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether only IMDSv2 is enabled. This control fails if the metadata version is not included in the launch configuration or if both IMDSv1 and IMDSv2 are enabled.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Auto Scaling group launch configurations should configure EC2 instances to require Instance Metadata Service Version 2 (IMDSv2)
GuardrailList.Name: SH.AutoScaling.3

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks the number of network hops that the metadata token can travel. This control fails if the metadata response hop limit is greater than 1.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Auto Scaling group launch configuration should not have a metadata response hop limit greater than 1
GuardrailList.Name: SH.AutoScaling.4

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling group uses multiple instance types. This control fails if the Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling group has only one instance type defined.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Auto Scaling groups should use multiple instance types in multiple Availability Zones
GuardrailList.Name: SH.AutoScaling.6

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling group is created from an EC2 launch template. This control fails if an Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling group is not created with a launch template or if a launch template is not specified in a mixed instances policy.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: EC2 Auto Scaling groups should use EC2 launch templates
GuardrailList.Name: SH.AutoScaling.9

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling groups have public IP addresses enabled using launch configurations.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Amazon EC2 instances launched using Auto Scaling group launch configurations should not have Public IP addresses
GuardrailList.Name: SH.Autoscaling.5

GuardrailList.Description: This AWS control checks that there is at least one multi-region AWS CloudTrail trail includes read and write management events.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: CloudTrail should be enabled and configured with at least one multi-Region trail that includes read and write management events
GuardrailList.Name: SH.CloudTrail.1

GuardrailList.Description: This AWS control checks whether AWS CloudTrail is configured to use the server side encryption (SSE) AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS) customer master key (CMK) encryption. The check will pass if the KmsKeyId is defined.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: CloudTrail should have encryption at-rest enabled
GuardrailList.Name: SH.CloudTrail.2

GuardrailList.Description: This AWS control checks whether CloudTrail log file validation is enabled.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: CloudTrail log file validation should be enabled
GuardrailList.Name: SH.CloudTrail.4

GuardrailList.Description: This AWS control checks whether AWS CloudTrail trails are configured to send logs to Amazon CloudWatch Logs.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: CloudTrail trails should be integrated with Amazon CloudWatch Logs
GuardrailList.Name: SH.CloudTrail.5

GuardrailList.Description: This AWS control checks whether the GitHub or Bitbucket source repository URL contains either personal access tokens or user name and password.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: CodeBuild GitHub or Bitbucket source repository URLs should use OAuth
GuardrailList.Name: SH.CodeBuild.1

GuardrailList.Description: This AWS control checks whether the project contains environment variables AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID and AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: CodeBuild project environment variables should not contain clear text credentials
GuardrailList.Name: SH.CodeBuild.2

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks if Amazon S3 logs for an AWS CodeBuild project are encrypted. The control fails if encryption is deactivated for S3 Logs for a CodeBuild project.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: CodeBuild S3 logs should be encrypted
GuardrailList.Name: SH.CodeBuild.3

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether a CodeBuild project environment has at least one log option enabled.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: CodeBuild project environments should have a logging configuration
GuardrailList.Name: SH.CodeBuild.4

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks if an AWS CodeBuild project environment has privileged mode enabled.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: CodeBuild project environments should not have privileged mode enabled
GuardrailList.Name: SH.CodeBuild.5

GuardrailList.Description: This AWS control checks whether AWS Database Migration Service replication instances are public by examining the PubliclyAccessible field value.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Database Migration Service replication instances should not be public
GuardrailList.Name: SH.DMS.1

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether a DynamoDB table can scale its read or write capacity as needed. This control passes if the table uses an on-demand capacity mode or if the table uses provisioned mode with automatic scaling configured.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: DynamoDB tables should automatically scale capacity with demand
GuardrailList.Name: SH.DynamoDB.1

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether point-in-time recovery (PITR) is enabled for a DynamoDB table.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: DynamoDB tables should have point-in-time recovery enabled
GuardrailList.Name: SH.DynamoDB.2

GuardrailList.Description: This AWS control checks whether Amazon Elastic Block Store snapshots are not publicly restorable.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: EBS snapshots should not be publicly restorable
GuardrailList.Name: SH.EC2.1

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether a service endpoint for Amazon EC2 is created for each VPC. The control fails if a VPC does not have a VPC endpoint created for the Amazon EC2 service.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Amazon EC2 should be configured to use VPC endpoints that are created for the Amazon EC2 service
GuardrailList.Name: SH.EC2.10

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks if the assignment of public IPs in Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) subnets have the MapPublicIpOnLaunch set to FALSE. The control will pass if the flag is set to FALSE.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: EC2 subnets should not automatically assign public IP addresses
GuardrailList.Name: SH.EC2.15

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks to see if there are any NACLs (Network Access Control List) that are unused. The control will check the item configuration of the resource AWS::EC2::NetworkAcl and determine the relationships of the NACL.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Unused Network Access Control Lists should be removed
GuardrailList.Name: SH.EC2.16

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks to see if Amazon EC2 instance uses multiple ENI/EFA. This control will pass if single network adapters is used.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: EC2 instances should not use multiple ENIs
GuardrailList.Name: SH.EC2.17

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether the security groups allow unrestricted incoming traffic. The control fails if ports allow unrestricted traffic on ports other than 80 and 443, which are default values for parameter authorizedTcpPorts.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Security groups should only allow unrestricted incoming traffic for authorized ports
GuardrailList.Name: SH.EC2.18

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether unrestricted incoming traffic for the security groups is accessible to the specified ports [3389, 20, 23, 110, 143, 3306, 8080, 1433, 9200, 9300, 25, 445, 135, 21, 1434, 4333, 5432, 5500, 5601, 22, 3000, 5000, 8088, 8888] that have the highest risk. This control passes when none of the rules in a security group allow ingress traffic from 0.0.0.0/0 for the listed ports.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Security groups should not allow unrestricted access to ports with high risk
GuardrailList.Name: SH.EC2.19

GuardrailList.Description: This AWS control checks that the default security group of a VPC does not allow inbound or outbound traffic.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: The VPC default security group should not allow inbound and outbound traffic
GuardrailList.Name: SH.EC2.2

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks that both VPN tunnels provided by AWS Site-to-Site VPN are in UP status. The control fails if one or both tunnels are in DOWN status.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Both VPN tunnels for an AWS Site-to-Site VPN connection should be up
GuardrailList.Name: SH.EC2.20

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether a network access control list (NACL) allows unrestricted access to the default ports for SSH/RDP ingress traffic. The rule fails if a NACL inbound entry allows a source CIDR block of '0.0.0.0/0' or '::/0' for ports 22 or 3389
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Network ACLs should not allow ingress from 0.0.0.0/0 to port 22 or port 3389
GuardrailList.Name: SH.EC2.21

GuardrailList.Description: This AWS control checks that security groups are attached to Amazon EC2 instances or to an elastic network interface. The control will fail the security group is not associated with an Amazon EC2 instance or an elastic network interface.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Unused EC2 security groups should be removed
GuardrailList.Name: SH.EC2.22

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks if Amazon EC2 launch templates are configured to assign public IP addresses to network interfaces upon launch. The control fails if an EC2 launch template is configured to assign a public IP address to network interfaces or if there is at least one network interface that has a public IP address.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: EC2 launch templates should not assign public IPs to network interfaces
GuardrailList.Name: SH.EC2.25

GuardrailList.Description: This AWS control checks whether the EBS volumes that are in an attached state are encrypted.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Attached EBS volumes should be encrypted at-rest
GuardrailList.Name: SH.EC2.3

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether any EC2 instances have been stopped for more than the allowed number of days. An EC2 instance fails this check if it is stopped for longer than the maximum allowed time period, which by default is 30 days.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Stopped EC2 instances should be removed after a specified time period
GuardrailList.Name: SH.EC2.4

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether Amazon Virtual Private Cloud flow logs are found and enabled for Amazon VPCs. The traffic type is set to 'Reject'.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: VPC flow logging should be enabled in all VPCs
GuardrailList.Name: SH.EC2.6

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether Amazon Elastic Block Store (EBS) encryption is enabled by default. The control fails if EBS default encryption is not enabled.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: EBS default encryption should be enabled
GuardrailList.Name: SH.EC2.7

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether your Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) instance metadata version is configured with Instance Metadata Service Version 2 (IMDSv2). The control passes if HttpTokens is set to required for IMDSv2. The control fails if HttpTokens is set to optional.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: EC2 instances should use Instance Metadata Service Version 2 (IMDSv2)
GuardrailList.Name: SH.EC2.8

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether EC2 instances have a public IP address. The control fails if the publicIp field is present in the EC2 instance configuration item. This control applies to IPv4 addresses only.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: EC2 instances should not have a public IPv4 address
GuardrailList.Name: SH.EC2.9

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether a private ECR repository has image scanning configured. This control fails if a private ECR repository doesnât have image scanning configured.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: ECR private repositories should have image scanning configured
GuardrailList.Name: SH.ECR.1

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether a private ECR repository has tag immutability configured. This control fails if a private ECR repository has tag immutability disabled. This rule passes if tag immutability is configured and has the value IMMUTABLE
GuardrailList.DisplayName: ECR private repositories should have tag immutability configured
GuardrailList.Name: SH.ECR.2

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether an ECR repository has at least one lifecycle policy configured. This control fails if an ECR repository does not have any lifecycle policies configured.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: ECR repositories should have at least one lifecycle policy configured
GuardrailList.Name: SH.ECR.3

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks if an Amazon ECS Task Definition with host networking mode has "privileged" or "user" container definitions. The control fails with host network mode and container definitions are privileged=false or empty and user=root or empty.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Amazon ECS task definitions should have secure networking modes and user definitions.
GuardrailList.Name: SH.ECS.1

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks if ECS Fargate services is running the latest Fargate platform version. This control fails if the platform version is not latest.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: ECS Fargate services should run on the latest Fargate platform version
GuardrailList.Name: SH.ECS.10

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks if ECS clusters use Container Insights. This control fails if Container Insights are not set up for a cluster.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: ECS clusters should use Container Insights
GuardrailList.Name: SH.ECS.12

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether ECS services are configured to automatically assign public IP addresses. This control fails if AssignPublicIP is ENABLED.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: ECS services should not have public IP addresses assigned to them automatically
GuardrailList.Name: SH.ECS.2

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks if Amazon ECS task definitions are configured to share a host's process namespace with its containers. This control fails if the task definition shares the host's process namespace with the containers running on it
GuardrailList.DisplayName: ECS task definitions should not share the host's process namespace
GuardrailList.Name: SH.ECS.3

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks if the privileged parameter in the container definition of Amazon ECS task definitions is set to 'true'. This control fails if this parameter is equal to 'true'.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: ECS containers should run as non-privileged
GuardrailList.Name: SH.ECS.4

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks if ECS containers are limited to read-only access to mounted root filesystems. This control fails if the ReadonlyRootFilesystem parameter in the container definition of ECS task definitions is set to âfalseâ.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: ECS containers should be limited to read-only access to root filesystems
GuardrailList.Name: SH.ECS.5

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks if the key value of any variables in the âenvironmentâ parameter of container definitions includes - AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY,  or ECS_ENGINE_AUTH_DATA.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Secrets should not be passed as container environment variables
GuardrailList.Name: SH.ECS.8

GuardrailList.Description: This AWS control checks whether Amazon Elastic File System (Amazon EFS) is configured to encrypt the file data using AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS). The check will fail if the encrypted key is set to false on DescribeFileSystems or if the KmsKeyId key on DescribeFileSystems does not match the KmsKeyId parameter.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Elastic File System should be configured to encrypt file data at-rest using AWS KMS
GuardrailList.Name: SH.EFS.1

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether Amazon Elastic File System (Amazon EFS) file systems are added to the backup plans in AWS Backup. The control fails if EFS file systems are not included in the backup plans.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Amazon EFS volumes should be in backup plans
GuardrailList.Name: SH.EFS.2

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks if Amazon Elastic File System (Amazon EFS) access points are configured to enforce a root directory. This control fails if the value of 'Path' is set to '/' (default root directory of the file system).
GuardrailList.DisplayName: EFS access points should enforce a root directory
GuardrailList.Name: SH.EFS.3

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether Amazon Elastic File System (Amazon EFS) access points are configured to enforce a user identity. This control fails if âPosixUserâ is not defined under âconfigurationâ or if parameters are provided and there is no match in the corresponding parameter.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: EFS access points should enforce a user identity
GuardrailList.Name: SH.EFS.4

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether an EKS cluster is running on a supported Kubernetes version. The control fails if the EKS cluster is running on an unsupported version.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: EKS clusters should run on a supported Kubernetes version
GuardrailList.Name: SH.EKS.2

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether a Classic Load Balancer has been configured to span multiple Availability Zones. The control fails if the Classic Load Balancer does not span multiple Availability Zones.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Classic Load Balancer should span multiple Availability Zones
GuardrailList.Name: SH.ELB.10

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether the Application Load Balancer is configured with defensive or strictest de-sync mitigation mode. This control fails if the Application Load Balancer is not configured with defensive or strictest desync mitigation mode.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Application Load Balancer should be configured with defensive or strictest desync mitigation mode
GuardrailList.Name: SH.ELB.12

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether an Elastic Load Balancer V2 (Application, Network, or Gateway Load Balancer) has registered instances from multiple Availability Zones. The control fails if an Elastic Load Balancer V2 has instances registered in less than 2 Availability Zones.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Application, Network and Gateway Load Balancers should span multiple Availability Zones
GuardrailList.Name: SH.ELB.13

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether the Classic Load Balancer is configured defensive or strictest desync mitigation mode. This control will fail if the Application Load Balancer is not configured with defensive strictest mitigation Desync mitigation mode.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Classic Load Balancer should be configured with defensive or strictest desync mitigation mode
GuardrailList.Name: SH.ELB.14

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether a Classic Load Balancer uses HTTPS/SSL certificates provided by AWS Certificate Manager. The control fails if a Classic Load Balancer that is configured with an HTTPS/SSL listener does not use a certificate provided by AWS Certificate Manager.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Classic Load Balancers with SSL/HTTPS listeners should use a certificate provided by AWS Certificate Manager
GuardrailList.Name: SH.ELB.2

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether your Classic Load Balancer listeners are configured with HTTPS or TLS protocol for front-end (client to load balancer) connections. The control is applicable if a Classic Load Balancer has listeners. If your Classic Load Balancer does not have a listener configured, then the control does not report any findings.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Classic Load Balancer listeners should be configured with HTTPS or TLS termination
GuardrailList.Name: SH.ELB.3

GuardrailList.Description: This control evaluates AWS Application Load Balancers (ALB) to ensure they are configured to drop http headers. By default, ALBs are not configured to drop invalid http header values. This control evaluates all ALBs fails if the attribute value of routing.http.drop_invalid_header_fields.enabled is set to false.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Application load balancer should be configured to drop http headers
GuardrailList.Name: SH.ELB.4

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether the Application Load Balancer and the Classic Load Balancer have logging enabled. The control fails if the access_logs.s3.enabled is false.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Application and Classic Load Balancers logging should be enabled
GuardrailList.Name: SH.ELB.5

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether an Application Load Balancer has deletion protection enabled. The control fails if deletion protection is not configured.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Application Load Balancer deletion protection should be enabled
GuardrailList.Name: SH.ELB.6

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether AWS Classic Load Balancers have connection draining enabled.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Classic Load Balancers should have connection draining enabled
GuardrailList.Name: SH.ELB.7

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether your Classic Load Balancer SSL listeners use the predefined policy ELBSecurityPolicy-TLS-1-2-2017-01. The control fails if the Classic Load Balancer SSL listeners do not use the predefined policy ELBSecurityPolicy-TLS-1-2-2017-01.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Classic Load Balancers with SSL listeners should use a predefined security policy that has strong configuration
GuardrailList.Name: SH.ELB.8

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether cross-zone load balancing is enabled for Classic Load Balancers. This control fails if cross-zone load balancing is not enabled for a Classic Load Balancer.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Classic Load Balancers should have cross-zone load balancing enabled
GuardrailList.Name: SH.ELB.9

GuardrailList.Description: This AWS control checks whether HTTP to HTTPS redirection is configured on all HTTP listeners of Application Load Balancers. The control will fail if one or more HTTP listeners of Application Load Balancers do not have HTTP to HTTPS redirection configured.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Application Load Balancer should be configured to redirect all HTTP requests to HTTPS
GuardrailList.Name: SH.ELBv2.1

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether master nodes on EMR clusters have public IP addresses.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Amazon Elastic MapReduce cluster master nodes should not have public IP addresses
GuardrailList.Name: SH.EMR.1

GuardrailList.Description: This AWS control checks whether Elasticsearch domains have encryption at rest configuration enabled. This check fails if the EncryptionAtRestOptions field is not enabled.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Elasticsearch domains should have encryption at-rest enabled
GuardrailList.Name: SH.ES.1

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether Elasticsearch domains are in a VPC. It does not evaluate the VPC subnet routing configuration to determine public reachability. This AWS control also does not check whether the Amazon OpenSearch Service resource-based policy permits public access by other accounts or external entities. You should ensure that Elasticsearch domains are not attached to public subnets. See Resource-based policies (https://docs.aws.amazon.com/elasticsearch-service/latest/developerguide/es-ac.html#es-ac-types-resource) in the Amazon OpenSearch Service (successor to Amazon Elasticsearch Service) Developer Guide. You should also ensure that your VPC is configured according to the recommended best practices. See Security best practices for your VPC (https://docs.aws.amazon.com/vpc/latest/userguide/vpc-security-best-practices.html) in the Amazon VPC User Guide.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Elasticsearch domains should be in a VPC
GuardrailList.Name: SH.ES.2

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether Elasticsearch domains have node-to-node encryption enabled.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Elasticsearch domains should encrypt data sent between nodes
GuardrailList.Name: SH.ES.3

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether Elasticsearch domains are configured to send error logs to CloudWatch Logs.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Elasticsearch domain error logging to CloudWatch Logs should be enabled
GuardrailList.Name: SH.ES.4

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether Elasticsearch domains have audit logging enabled. This control fails if an Elasticsearch domain does not have audit logging enabled.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Elasticsearch domains should have audit logging enabled
GuardrailList.Name: SH.ES.5

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether Elasticsearch domains are configured with at least three data nodes and zoneAwarenessEnabled is true.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Elasticsearch domains should have at least three data nodes
GuardrailList.Name: SH.ES.6

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether Elasticsearch domains are configured with at least three dedicated master nodes. This control fails if dedicatedMasterEnabled is not true.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Elasticsearch domains should be configured with at least three dedicated master nodes
GuardrailList.Name: SH.ES.7

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether connections to Elasticsearch domains are required to use TLS 1.2.  The check fails if the Elasticsearch domain TLSSecurityPolicy is not Policy-Min-TLS-1-2-2019-07.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Connections to Elasticsearch domains should be encrypted using TLS 1.2
GuardrailList.Name: SH.ES.8

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether enhanced health reporting is enabled for your AWS Elastic Beanstalk environments.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Elastic Beanstalk environments should have enhanced health reporting enabled
GuardrailList.Name: SH.ElasticBeanstalk.1

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether managed platform updates are enabled for the AWS Elastic Beanstalk environment.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Elastic Beanstalk managed platform updates should be enabled
GuardrailList.Name: SH.ElasticBeanstalk.2

GuardrailList.Description: This AWS control checks whether Amazon GuardDuty is enabled in your AWS account and region.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: GuardDuty should be enabled
GuardrailList.Name: SH.GuardDuty.1

GuardrailList.Description: This AWS control checks whether the default version of AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) policies (also known as customer managed policies) do not have administrator access with a statement that has "Effect": "Allow" with "Action": "*" over "Resource": "*". It only checks for the Customer Managed Policies that you created, but not inline and AWS Managed Policies.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: IAM policies should not allow full "*" administrative privileges
GuardrailList.Name: SH.IAM.1

GuardrailList.Description: This AWS control checks that none of your IAM users have policies attached. Instead, IAM users must inherit permissions from IAM groups or roles.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: IAM users should not have IAM policies attached
GuardrailList.Name: SH.IAM.2

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether the IAM identity-based custom policies have Allow statements that grant permissions for all actions on a service. The control fails if any policy statement includes "Effect": "Allow" with "Action": "Service:*".
GuardrailList.DisplayName: IAM customer managed policies that you create should not allow wildcard actions for services
GuardrailList.Name: SH.IAM.21

GuardrailList.Description: This AWS control checks whether the active access keys are rotated within 90 days.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: IAM users' access keys should be rotated every 90 days or less
GuardrailList.Name: SH.IAM.3

GuardrailList.Description: This AWS control checks whether the root user access key is available.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: IAM root user access key should not exist
GuardrailList.Name: SH.IAM.4

GuardrailList.Description: This AWS control checks whether AWS Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) is enabled for all AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) users that use a console password.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: MFA should be enabled for all IAM users that have a console password
GuardrailList.Name: SH.IAM.5

GuardrailList.Description: This AWS control checks whether your AWS account is enabled to use a hardware multi-factor authentication (MFA) device to sign in with root user credentials.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Hardware MFA should be enabled for the root user
GuardrailList.Name: SH.IAM.6

GuardrailList.Description: This AWS control checks whether the account password policy for IAM users uses the following recommended configurations: RequireUppercaseCharacters: true, RequireLowercaseCharacters: true, RequireSymbols: true, RequireNumbers: true, MinimumPasswordLength: 8.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Password policies for IAM users should have strong configurations
GuardrailList.Name: SH.IAM.7

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether your IAM users have passwords or active access keys that were not used within the previous 90 days.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Unused IAM user credentials should be removed
GuardrailList.Name: SH.IAM.8

GuardrailList.Description: Checks whether the default version of IAM customer managed policies allow principals to use the AWS Key Management Service (KMS) decryption actions on all resources. This control fails if kms:Decrypt or kms:ReEncryptFrom actions are allowed on all KMS keys. The control evaluates both attached and unattached customer managed policies. It does not check inline policies or AWS managed policies.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: IAM customer managed policies should not allow decryption actions on all KMS keys
GuardrailList.Name: SH.KMS.1

GuardrailList.Description: Checks whether the inline policies embedded in your IAM principals (Role/User/Group) allow the AWS Key Management Service (KMS) decryption actions on all KMS keys. This control fails if kms:Decrypt or kms:ReEncryptFrom actions are allowed on all KMS keys in an inline policy.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: IAM principals should not have IAM inline policies that allow decryption actions on all KMS keys
GuardrailList.Name: SH.KMS.2

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether AWS Key Management Service (KMS) customer managed keys (CMK) are scheduled for deletion. The control fails if a KMS CMK is scheduled for deletion.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: AWS KMS keys should not be deleted unintentionally
GuardrailList.Name: SH.KMS.3

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks if Kinesis streams are encrypted at rest with server-side encryption. This control fails if a Kinesis stream is not encrypted at rest with server-side encryption.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Kinesis streams should be encrypted at rest
GuardrailList.Name: SH.Kinesis.1

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether the AWS Lambda function policy attached to the Lambda resource prohibits public access. If the Lambda function policy allows public access, the control fails.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Lambda function policies should prohibit public access
GuardrailList.Name: SH.Lambda.1

GuardrailList.Description: This AWS control checks that the lambda function settings for runtimes, match the expected values set for the supported runtimes for each language. The supported runtimes this control checks for are: nodejs16.x, nodejs14.x, nodejs12.x, python3.8, python3.7, java11, java8, go1.x, dotnet6, dotnetcore3.1, ruby2.7.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Lambda functions should use supported runtimes
GuardrailList.Name: SH.Lambda.2

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks if Lambda has more than one Availability Zone (AZ) associated. The rule fails if only one AZ is associated with Lambda.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: VPC Lambda functions should operate in more than one Availability Zone
GuardrailList.Name: SH.Lambda.5

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether a Network Firewall policy has any stateful or stateless rule groups associated. This control fails if stateless or stateful rule groups are not assigned.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Network Firewall policies should have at least one rule group associated
GuardrailList.Name: SH.NetworkFirewall.3

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether the default stateless action for full packets for a Network Firewall policy is drop or forward. The control passes if Drop or Forward is selected, and fails if Pass is selected.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: The default stateless action for Network Firewall policies should be drop or forward for full packets
GuardrailList.Name: SH.NetworkFirewall.4

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether a Network Firewall policy has drop or forward as the default stateless action for fragmented packets. The control passes if Drop or Forward is selected, and fails if Pass is selected.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: The default stateless action for Network Firewall policies should be drop or forward for fragmented packets
GuardrailList.Name: SH.NetworkFirewall.5

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks if a Stateless Network Firewall Rule Group contains rules. The rule will fail if there are no rules in a Stateless Network Firewall Rule Group.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Stateless network firewall rule group should not be empty
GuardrailList.Name: SH.NetworkFirewall.6

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether Amazon OpenSearch domains have encryption-at-rest configuration enabled. The check fails if encryption at rest is not enabled.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: OpenSearch domains should have encryption at rest enabled
GuardrailList.Name: SH.Opensearch.1

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks Amazon OpenSearch Service domains are in an Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (VPC).
GuardrailList.DisplayName: OpenSearch domains should be in a VPC
GuardrailList.Name: SH.Opensearch.2

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether Amazon OpenSearch domains have node-to-node encryption enabled. This control fails if node-to-node encryption is disabled on the domain.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: OpenSearch domains should encrypt data sent between nodes
GuardrailList.Name: SH.Opensearch.3

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether Amazon OpenSearch domains are configured to send error logs to CloudWatch Logs. This control fails if error logging to CloudWatch is not enabled for a domain.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: OpenSearch domain error logging to CloudWatch Logs should be enabled
GuardrailList.Name: SH.Opensearch.4

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether Amazon OpenSearch Service domains have audit logging enabled.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: OpenSearch domains should have audit logging enabled
GuardrailList.Name: SH.Opensearch.5

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether Amazon OpenSearch Service domains are configured with at least three data nodes and "zoneAwarenessEnabled" is true.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: OpenSearch domains should have at least three data nodes
GuardrailList.Name: SH.Opensearch.6

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether Amazon OpenSearch domains have fine-grained access control enabled. This control fails if the fine-grained access control is not enabled.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: OpenSearch domains should have fine-grained access control enabled
GuardrailList.Name: SH.Opensearch.7

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether connections to OpenSearch domains are required to use TLS 1.2. The check fails if the OpenSearch domain TLSSecurityPolicy is not Policy-Min-TLS-1-2-2019-07.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Connections to OpenSearch domains should be encrypted using TLS 1.2
GuardrailList.Name: SH.Opensearch.8

GuardrailList.Description: This AWS control checks if Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) snapshots are public.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: RDS snapshot should be private
GuardrailList.Name: SH.RDS.1

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether an RDS DB instance has IAM database authentication enabled.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: IAM authentication should be configured for RDS instances
GuardrailList.Name: SH.RDS.10

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether RDS DB instances have automated backups enabled. It also checks whether the backup retention period is greater than or equal to 7. The control passes if all of the fallowing are true: backups are enabled; the backup retention period is greater than or equal to the retentionPeriod; and the retention period is greater than or equal to 7.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: RDS instances should have automatic backups enabled
GuardrailList.Name: SH.RDS.11

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks if automatic minor version upgrades are enabled for the Amazon RDS database instance.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: RDS automatic minor version upgrades should be enabled
GuardrailList.Name: SH.RDS.13

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether RDS DB instances are configured to copy all tags to snapshots when the snapshots are created.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: RDS DB instances should be configured to copy tags to snapshots
GuardrailList.Name: SH.RDS.17

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether an RDS instance is deployed in a VPC (EC2-VPC).
GuardrailList.DisplayName: RDS instances should be deployed in a VPC
GuardrailList.Name: SH.RDS.18

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon RDS Event subscription for RDS clusters is configured to notify on event categories of both "maintenance" and "failure".
GuardrailList.DisplayName: An RDS event notifications subscription should be configured for critical cluster events
GuardrailList.Name: SH.RDS.19

GuardrailList.Description: This AWS control checks whether RDS instances are publicly accessible by evaluating the publiclyAccessible field in the instance configuration item.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: RDS DB Instances should prohibit public access, as determined by the PubliclyAccessible configuration
GuardrailList.Name: SH.RDS.2

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon RDS Event subscription for RDS instances is configured to notify on event categories of both "maintenance", "configuration change", and "failure".
GuardrailList.DisplayName: An RDS event notifications subscription should be configured for critical database instance events
GuardrailList.Name: SH.RDS.20

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon RDS Event subscription for RDS parameter groups is configured to notify on event category of "configuration change".
GuardrailList.DisplayName: An RDS event notifications subscription should be configured for critical database parameter group events
GuardrailList.Name: SH.RDS.21

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon RDS Event subscription for RDS security groups is configured to notify on event categories of both "configuration change" and "failure".
GuardrailList.DisplayName: An RDS event notifications subscription should be configured for critical database security group events
GuardrailList.Name: SH.RDS.22

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether RDS instances use the default port of that database engine.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: RDS instances should not use a database engine default port
GuardrailList.Name: SH.RDS.23

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) database instance has changed the admin username from its default value. This rule will only run on RDS database instances. The rule will fail if the admin username is set to the default value.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: RDS database instances should use a custom administrator username
GuardrailList.Name: SH.RDS.25

GuardrailList.Description: This AWS control checks whether storage encryption is enabled for your RDS DB instances.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: RDS DB instances should have encryption at-rest enabled
GuardrailList.Name: SH.RDS.3

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether Amazon RDS cluster snapshots and database snapshots are encrypted.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: RDS cluster snapshots and database snapshots should be encrypted at rest
GuardrailList.Name: SH.RDS.4

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether high availability is enabled for your RDS DB instances.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: RDS DB instances should be configured with multiple Availability Zones
GuardrailList.Name: SH.RDS.5

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether enhanced monitoring is enabled for your RDS DB instances.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Enhanced monitoring should be configured for RDS DB instances
GuardrailList.Name: SH.RDS.6

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether RDS DB instances have deletion protection enabled.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: RDS DB instances should have deletion protection enabled
GuardrailList.Name: SH.RDS.8

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether the following Amazon RDS logs are enabled and sent to CloudWatch Logs: Oracle: (Alert, Audit, Trace, Listener), PostgreSQL: (Postgresql, Upgrade), MySQL: (Audit, Error, General, SlowQuery), MariaDB: (Audit, Error, General, SlowQuery), SQL Server: (Error, Agent), Aurora: (Audit, Error, General, SlowQuery), Aurora-MySQL: (Audit, Error, General, SlowQuery), Aurora-PostgreSQL: (Postgresql).
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Database logging should be enabled
GuardrailList.Name: SH.RDS.9

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether Amazon Redshift clusters are publicly accessible. It evaluates the publiclyAccessible field in the cluster configuration item.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Amazon Redshift clusters should prohibit public access
GuardrailList.Name: SH.Redshift.1

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks if an Amazon Redshift cluster is encrypted at rest. The control fails if a Redshift cluster isn't encrypted at rest.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Redshift clusters should be encrypted at rest
GuardrailList.Name: SH.Redshift.10

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether connections to Amazon Redshift clusters are required to use encryption in transit. The check fails if the Amazon Redshift cluster parameter require_SSL is not set to 1.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Connections to Amazon Redshift clusters should be encrypted in transit
GuardrailList.Name: SH.Redshift.2

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon Redshift cluster has audit logging enabled.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Amazon Redshift clusters should have audit logging enabled
GuardrailList.Name: SH.Redshift.4

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon Redshift cluster is configured with automatic upgrades to major versions.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Amazon Redshift should have automatic upgrades to major versions enabled
GuardrailList.Name: SH.Redshift.6

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether a Redshift cluster has EnhancedVpcRouting enabled.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Redshift clusters should use enhanced VPC routing
GuardrailList.Name: SH.Redshift.7

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether a Redshift cluster has changed the Admin username from its default value. This control will fail if the admin username for a Redshift cluster is set to 'awsuser'.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Amazon Redshift clusters should not use the default Admin username
GuardrailList.Name: SH.Redshift.8

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether a Redshift cluster has changed the database name from its default value. This control will fail if the database name for a Redshift cluster is set to âdevâ
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Redshift clusters should not use the default database name
GuardrailList.Name: SH.Redshift.9

GuardrailList.Description: This AWS control checks whether the following public access block settings are configured from account level: ignorePublicAcls: True, blockPublicPolicy: True, blockPublicAcls: True, restrictPublicBuckets: True.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: S3 Block Public Access setting should be enabled
GuardrailList.Name: SH.S3.1

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks if Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) version enabled buckets have lifecycle policy configured. This rule fails if Amazon S3 lifecycle policy is not enabled.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: S3 buckets with versioning enabled should have lifecycle policies configured
GuardrailList.Name: SH.S3.10

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks if S3 Event Notifications are enabled on an S3 bucket. This control fails if S3 Event Notifications are not enabled on a bucket.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: S3 buckets should have event notifications enabled
GuardrailList.Name: SH.S3.11

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks if S3 buckets allow user permissions via access control lists (ACLs). This control fails if ACLs are configured for user access on S3 Bucket.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: S3 access control lists (ACLs) should not be used to manage user access to buckets
GuardrailList.Name: SH.S3.12

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks if a lifecycle policy is configured for an S3 bucket. This control fails if the lifecycle policy is not configured for an S3 bucket.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: S3 buckets should have lifecycle policies configured
GuardrailList.Name: SH.S3.13

GuardrailList.Description: This AWS control checks whether your S3 buckets allow public read access by evaluating the Block Public Access settings, the bucket policy, and the bucket access control list (ACL).
GuardrailList.DisplayName: S3 buckets should prohibit public read access
GuardrailList.Name: SH.S3.2

GuardrailList.Description: This AWS control checks whether your S3 buckets allow public write access by evaluating the Block Public Access settings, the bucket policy, and the bucket access control list (ACL).
GuardrailList.DisplayName: S3 buckets should prohibit public write access
GuardrailList.Name: SH.S3.3

GuardrailList.Description: This AWS control checks that your Amazon S3 bucket either has Amazon S3 default encryption enabled or that the S3 bucket policy explicitly denies put-object requests without server side encryption.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: S3 buckets should have server-side encryption enabled
GuardrailList.Name: SH.S3.4

GuardrailList.Description: This AWS control checks whether S3 buckets have policies that require requests to use Secure Socket Layer (SSL).
GuardrailList.DisplayName: S3 buckets should require requests to use Secure Socket Layer
GuardrailList.Name: SH.S3.5

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether the S3 bucket policy allows sensitive bucket-level or object-level actions from a principal in another AWS account. The control fails if any of the following actions are allowed in the S3 bucket policy for a principal in another AWS account: s3:DeleteBucketPolicy, s3:PutBucketAcl, s3:PutBucketPolicy, s3:PutObjectAcl, and s3:PutEncryptionConfiguration.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: S3 permissions granted to other AWS accounts in bucket policies should be restricted
GuardrailList.Name: SH.S3.6

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks if Amazon S3 buckets have bucket level public access blocks applied. This control fails if any of the bucket level settings are set to "false" public: ignorePublicAcls, blockPublicPolicy, blockPublicAcls, restrictPublicBuckets.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: S3 Block Public Access setting should be enabled at the bucket-level
GuardrailList.Name: SH.S3.8

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks if an Amazon S3 Bucket has server access logging enabled to a chosen target bucket.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: S3 bucket server access logging should be enabled
GuardrailList.Name: SH.S3.9

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether an Amazon SNS topic is encrypted at rest using AWS KMS.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: SNS topics should be encrypted at-rest using AWS KMS
GuardrailList.Name: SH.SNS.1

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether logging is enabled for the delivery status of notification messages sent to a topic for the endpoints. This control fails if the delivery status notification for messages is not enabled.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Logging of delivery status should be enabled for notification messages sent to a topic
GuardrailList.Name: SH.SNS.2

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether Amazon SQS queues are encrypted at rest.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Amazon SQS queues should be encrypted at rest
GuardrailList.Name: SH.SQS.1

GuardrailList.Description: This AWS control checks whether the Amazon EC2 instances in your account are managed by AWS Systems Manager.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: EC2 instances should be managed by AWS Systems Manager
GuardrailList.Name: SH.SSM.1

GuardrailList.Description: This AWS control checks whether the compliance status of the Amazon EC2 Systems Manager patch compliance is COMPLIANT or NON_COMPLIANT after the patch installation on the instance. It only checks instances that are managed by AWS Systems Manager Patch Manager.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: EC2 instances managed by Systems Manager should have a patch compliance status of COMPLIANT after a patch installation
GuardrailList.Name: SH.SSM.2

GuardrailList.Description: This AWS control checks whether the status of the AWS Systems Manager association compliance is COMPLIANT or NON_COMPLIANT after the association is executed on an instance.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: EC2 instances managed by Systems Manager should have an association compliance status of COMPLIANT
GuardrailList.Name: SH.SSM.3

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether AWS Systems Manager documents that the account owns are public. This control fails if SSM documents that have "Self" as the owner are public.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: SSM documents should not be public
GuardrailList.Name: SH.SSM.4

GuardrailList.Description: This AWS control checks whether direct internet access is disabled for an Amazon SageMaker notebook instance by examining the DirectInternetAccess field is disabled for an Amazon SageMaker notebook instance.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Amazon SageMaker notebook instances should not have direct internet access
GuardrailList.Name: SH.SageMaker.1

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks if an Amazon SageMaker notebook instance is launched within a custom VPC. The control fails if a SageMaker notebook instance is not launched within a custom VPC.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: SageMaker notebook instances should be launched in a custom VPC
GuardrailList.Name: SH.SageMaker.2

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether root access is turned off for Amazon SageMaker notebook instances. The control fails if root access is turned on for a SageMaker notebook instance.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Users should not have root access to SageMaker notebook instances
GuardrailList.Name: SH.SageMaker.3

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether a secret stored in AWS Secrets Manager is configured to rotate automatically.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Secrets Manager secrets should have automatic rotation enabled
GuardrailList.Name: SH.SecretsManager.1

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether an AWS Secrets Manager secret rotated successfully based on the rotation schedule. The control fails if RotationOccurringAsScheduled is false. The control does not evaluate secrets that do not have rotation configured.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Secrets Manager secrets configured with automatic rotation should rotate successfully
GuardrailList.Name: SH.SecretsManager.2

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether your secrets have been accessed within a specified number of days. The default value is 90 days. Secrets that have not been accessed even once within the number days you define, fail this check.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Remove unused Secrets Manager secrets
GuardrailList.Name: SH.SecretsManager.3

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks if your secrets have rotated at least once within 90 days.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: Secrets Manager secrets should be rotated within a specified number of days
GuardrailList.Name: SH.SecretsManager.4

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether a WAFV2 web ACL contains at least one WAF rule or WAF rule group. The control fails if a web ACL does not contain any WAF rule or rule group.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: A WAFV2 web ACL should have at least one rule or rule group
GuardrailList.Name: SH.WAF.10

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether a WAF Regional rule has at least one condition. The control fails if no conditions are present within a rule.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: A WAF Regional rule should have at least one condition
GuardrailList.Name: SH.WAF.2

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether a WAF Regional rule group has at least one rule. The control fails if no rules are present within a rule group.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: A WAF Regional rule group should have at least one rule
GuardrailList.Name: SH.WAF.3

GuardrailList.Description: This control checks whether a WAF Regional web ACL contains any WAF rules or WAF rule groups. This control fails if a web ACL does not contain any WAF rules or rule groups.
GuardrailList.DisplayName: A WAF Regional web ACL should have at least one rule or rule group
GuardrailList.Name: SH.WAF.4
